body:
BTW, not sure is intended: those `=` lines extend to the right just enough to cover the longest full type name, but not the final text `(Destination member list)`:

```
=================
xxx -> yyy (Destination member list)
aaaaaa -> bbbbbb (Destination member list)
```

Yeah, ideally we'd do a PR. It's just that now we're fighting against an AutoMapperMappingException due to a NullReferenceException, and struggling to find the reason. Stacktrace is not really helping.
If it's the latest version, make a repro and we'll help.

It's the latest stable. Managed to grab a stacktrace with linenumbers after swapping package DLLs with a debug build. Could that help?

At some point at runtime, after passing AssertConfigurationIsValid, when performing a mapping, `Mapper.Map` [here](https://github.com/AutoMapper/AutoMapper/blob/f3e345d958bb999a54c53e73660b51bf6e8c69ee/src/AutoMapper/Mapper.cs#L232) generates a null destination and passes that down to mapper function:

```
var destination = default(TDestination);
return func(source, destination, _defaultContext);
```

That value goes into `ResolutionContext.Map` [here](https://github.com/AutoMapper/AutoMapper/blob/f3e345d958bb999a54c53e73660b51bf6e8c69ee/src/AutoMapper/ResolutionContext.cs#L97):

```
a(source, destination, this);
```

and inside this call (no line number for that invoked code) a NullReferenceException is thrown, I guess because `destination` is null. Now we don't know how to proceed further with investigation.

PS thanks for being ready to help!
I'm not that much into guessing :) I need a repro.

Problem was due to IValueResolver implementation not being registered through DI. Do you know which part of the code is responsible for obtaining value resolvers out of service constructor? Maybe there's place for an exception when resolver cannot be obtained.

issue.title: Break long line in AutoMapperConfigurationException
issue.body:
1. Fixes #1547
2. Ran all UnitTests.Net4: all succeeded, apart from 5 skipped
3. IntegrationTests.Net4 not ran: they were somehow hanging in VS2015, right at the beginning

body: Thanks for initial pointer. It seems like [this bit](https://github.com/AutoMapper/AutoMapper/blob/23278c6128f6c9978c53c3af14a3eea217515b5b/src/AutoMapper/Execution/TypeMapPlanBuilder.cs#L400) in `TypeMapPlanBuilder` has something to do, but from first look it's reasonably convoluted (at the least to someone not used to the library). Will have to look at that again later, or take advantage of more hints.
That will eventually call the function I linked to :)

Yes, sure. The point is when that function is **actually** called, because when someone will ask for a value resolver to it, that will return null. And maybe that is the cause of null ref. exception.

But it is not really ease (for me, of course) to see where actually the service constructor is invoked, where its return value is grabbed.
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
